availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah E. Ward Rogers on June 8, 1860 in Bath County, Kentucky. Father of James W. Rogers. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in 7th Kentucky Cavalry.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 186.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Centerville, p. 342A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p.168.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #603384, Certificate #413191.
